title: Using existing package with different compiler and multiple installations
body:
I was wondering why I have two hdf5 packages installed with same compiler and same variant:

``` bash
spack find -v  hdf5 %gcc
==> 2 installed packages.
-- linux-redhat6-x86_64 / gcc@4.9.0 -----------------------------
hdf5@1.10.0-patch1+cxx~debug~fortran+mpi+shared~szip~threadsafe
hdf5@1.10.0-patch1+cxx~debug~fortran+mpi+shared~szip~threadsafe
```

(they have different hash though, so may not be same problem as in #2087).

As hash different, I thought there might be some changes, fine.

Now I see below:

``` bash
 spack install hdf5 +mpi %gcc
==> hdf5 is already installed in /some_path//linux-redhat6-x86_64/gcc-4.9.0/hdf5-1.10.0-patch1-gkx34kcxlc7yyy75zhgbdhtuodmm65pp

→ spack install hdf5 %gcc
==> hdf5 is already installed in /some_path//linux-redhat6-x86_64/gcc-4.9.0/hdf5-1.10.0-patch1-gkx34kcxlc7yyy75zhgbdhtuodmm65pp
```

I understand `+mpi` is `on` and hence thats the same package. Now I want to use this `hdf5` with `PGI` compiler:

``` bash
spack install mypkg %pgi ^hdf5%gcc
==> Installing mypkg
==> mvapich2 is externally installed in /some_path/mvapich2-2.0.1-nocuda-slurm-14.03.4.2/install
==> cmake is externally installed in cmake-3.6.1-gcc-4.4.7-xhpqagp
==> Installing hdf5
….
```

Why installing hdf5 again?

And then adding `+mpi` : 

``` bash
spack install mypkg %pgi ^hdf5+mpi%gcc
==> Installing mypkg
==> mvapich2 is externally installed in /some_path/mvapich2-2.0.1-nocuda-slurm-14.03.4.2/install
==> cmake is externally installed in cmake-3.6.1-gcc-4.4.7-xhpqagp
==> hdf5 is already installed in ...
```

Why adding `+mpi` variant makes difference?
